title: Internet of Things in Healthcare and Medical Devices
desc: The?IoT is the network of physical objects or "things" embedded with electronics, software, sensors, and network connectivity, which enables these objects to collect and exchange data. It has many possible applications, one of which is healthcare and medical devices. Forbes reported recently that there is a $117 billion market for IoT in healthcare by 2020  . These, and other promising applications, makes IoT hugely attractive for a new start-up generation.? Please join us to discover more! Prof Mischa Dohler, Professor of Wireless Communication, Rober Miller, Head of Smart Energy Practice,? Paul de Panisse, Lead Engineer,? Dr Dan Vahdat, Chief Technology Officer,
